benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/phase - Retrieve phase for a given subscription and date

covered: Valid Request: TC01 verifies successful retrieval (HTTP 200), Content-Type application/json and presence of a Phase object.
Query parameters & validation: TC02–TC08 and TC14 exercise combinations of subscriptionId/requestedDate, missing parameters, invalid formats, non-existent subscription and out-of-range dates.
Error handling (4xx/404): TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC08 cover client error scenarios and not-found behavior.
Authorization (unauthorized): TC09 covers missing/invalid token returning 401.
Dependency failures (503): TC10 covers service/unavailability handling.
Security: TC11 covers SQL-injection style inputs and ensures internal errors are not exposed.
Empty data & edge cases: TC12 (empty DB) and TC15 (boundary date/regression) cover edge behaviors.
Performance & scalability: TC13 (large dataset) and TC16 (concurrent requests) cover basic performance and concurrency expectations.
Extra params: TC14 confirms unsupported query parameters are ignored and do not affect result.
Pagination: N/A — endpoint returns a single Phase object, so pagination is not applicable.
gaps: Caching behavior: No tests assert presence/semantics of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or If-None-Match / 304 flows.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests exercising request bursts to verify 429 responses or retry-after semantics.
Schema validation: Tests assert a "Phase object" is present but do not validate the response against the canonical Phase JSON schema (#/definitions/Phase) or check required fields/data types.
Error response schema & headers: Error scenarios do not validate a consistent error payload structure nor that error responses use application/json Content-Type uniformly.
Authorization completeness: Missing tests for forbidden access (403), valid token with insufficient permissions, expired tokens, and tenant/permission boundary cases.

Ambiguous contract for omitted parameters: TC02 and TC04 show inconsistent expected behaviors for omitted parameters (TC02 allows default/200, TC04 expects 400). The API contract for "subscriptionId only" or "no parameters" needs to be clarified and tests aligned to that contract.
Date/time edge cases: No tests for timezone handling, date-time (ISO-8601 with time) vs date-only inputs, or locale-related date parsing edge cases.
Cache invalidation / consistency: No tests that changing a subscription/phase is reflected immediately (stale-cache scenarios).
HTTP header / content negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling, Vary, or other relevant response headers beyond a single Content-Type check in the success path.
recommendations: Add JSON Schema validation tests for successful responses: validate the Phase object fields, types and required properties against /definitions/Phase.
Add error-schema tests: verify error responses have a stable JSON structure, consistent field names (code/message), and Content-Type: application/json for all error responses.
Add caching tests: assert ETag and Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers on responses; test If-None-Match to confirm 304 behavior and cache TTL/validation semantics.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to confirm 429 responses and presence/semantics of Retry-After headers.
Expand auth tests: include 403 forbidden (valid token but insufficient rights), expired/revoked tokens, and multi-tenant/permission boundary tests.
Clarify API contract for parameter omission and add explicit tests for "subscriptionId only" and "no parameters" cases to remove ambiguity (TC02 vs TC04).
Add date/time format tests: include ISO-8601 date-times with timezones, offsets, and explicitly invalid but borderline formats to ensure precise validation and behavior on boundary timestamps.
Add header and content-negotiation tests: verify Accept handling, Vary, and other headers (e.g., ensure error responses return JSON when Accept: application/json).
Add cache-invalidation/regression tests: update subscription/phase data and verify the endpoint returns updated Phase per cache rules (or immediate consistency if required).
Strengthen performance testing: extend TC13/TC16 into stress tests with measured SLA thresholds and include interactions with rate limiting.
Automate contract testing: integrate OpenAPI/JSON-Schema contract checks into CI so schema regressions are detected automatically.
Ensure security hygiene tests: expand injection tests to other inputs and verify no internal stack traces or sensitive data are leaked (complements TC11).
